This case having been finally heard today, the court delivered the following:
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 294(b), 341 and
323 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. Prosecution case in brief is as follows:- Due to the prior enmity ,the accused
with an intention to voluntarily cause hurt to CWland CW2 ,on 7.3.2013 at
10.00 pm , wrongfully restrained CW2 and caught hold on his shirt ,at the
pathway that situated to the south - west of TC47/1191,Koruvilakm , Bala
Nagar ,Muttathara Village ,and by uttering obscene words hit on his neck
multiple times .It is alleged that when CW1 intervened the accused caught hold
on his shirt and hit on his back . Thus the accused has committed offences
punishable u/ss. 294(b), 341 and 323 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed by the Sub Inspector of police, Poonthura police station
before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II, Thiruvananthapuram and
the case was taken on file as C.C. 1394/2013. Cognizance was taken for the
offences punishable u/ss. 294(b), 341 and 323 of Indian Penal Code, 1860
against the accused.. Thereafter, it was transferred to this court, in pursuance of
the order of the Hon'ble Chief Judicial Magistrate, Thiruvananthapuram, the

3 Of 6
case was refiled as CC. 605/2017.

4. On appearance of accused he was enlarged on bail on07.03.2013. On his
appearance relevant records of prosecution were served u/s. 207 Code of
Criminal Procedure, 1973. Particulars of offences punishable under sections
294(b), 341 and 323 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 read over and explained to the
accused. He pleaded not guilty and claimed to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 and PW2 were examined and Exhibit P1 was
marked. As the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the
learned Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW3 to CW7. In the absence
of any incriminating circumstances against the accused questioning of the
accused, under section 313(1)(b) of Cr.P.C. was dispensed with. Accused was
called upon to adduce evidence but no defence evidence was adduced from the
side of the accused..

6. Heard both sides.

7. Points that arose for consideration are as follows:-

1, Whether on 7.3.2013 at 10 pm the accused with the intention to voluntarily
cause hurt to CW2 wrongfully restrained him by caught hold on his shirt at
the pathway that situated to the south - west of TC47/1191, Koruvilakm ,
Bala Nagar ,Muttathara Village ,and thereby committed the offence u/s.341
of IPC ?

2. Whether on the same day and same time the accused uttered the obscene

40f6
word moewosil against CW2 and thereby committed the offence u/s.294(b)
of the Indian Penal Code?

3. Whether on the same day at the same time and place,the accused hit on the
neck of CW2 multiple times and when CW1 intervened the accused caught
hold on his shirt and hit on his back and thereby the accused committed an
offence u/s.323 of Indian Penal Code ?

4. If the accused is found guilty? What is the order as to sentence?

8. Point Nos. 1 to 3 :-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point nos. 1 to 3 are
considered together. Prosecution case is that accused has committed offences
punishable under sections 294(b), 341 and 323 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

9. PW1 Asokan admitted his signature in the Ext P1 statement .He deposed that
he has no grievance against the accused person and cannot recollect the
identity of the person who assaulted him. According to him the accused was
not assaulted him.

10. PW2 Suresh Kumar deposed that he was not assaulted by any body , and the
accused was not assaulted him. On analysing the evidence of PW1 and PW2,
there is nothing to show that the accused had assaulted them.

11. Learned Assistant Public Prosecutor has given up the other witnesses in this
case and he is justified in doing so as the material witness failed to support the

5 OF 6
prosecution case. There is nothing on record to disclose that the accused has
committed the offences as alleged by the prosecution. Having considered the
evidence on record, this court is of the view that the prosecution has failed to
prove the guilt of the accused and for the said reasons, point nos. 1 to 3 are
found against the prosecution.

12. Point No. 4 :- Upon the findings in Point Nos. 1 to 3, the the accused is found
not guilty of offences punishable under sections 294(b), 341 and 323 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860 and he is acquitted of the said offences under section 255(1)
Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. His bail bond stands cancelled and he is
set at liberty.

No material objects are produced in this case.
